Name: Antananarivo
Description: Antananarivo (AN-tan-AN-ah-REEV-oo) (City of a Thousand), also known as Tana, is the capital of Madagascar.

Name: Ambalavao
Description: Ambalavao is a city in the Fianarantsoa Province of Madagascar.

Name: Ambositra
Description: Ambositra (pronounced 'Ambushed') is a city in Madagascar, renowned for its traditional decorative paper-making.

Name: Antsirabe
Description: Antsirabe (City of much salt) is located in the central highlands of Madagascar.  In 2013, it had an population of around 240,000.

Name: Fianarantsoa
Description: Fianarantsoa, commonly abbreviated as Fianar, is a city in the Fianarantsoa Province of Madagascar.  Due to its central location, it is a gateway city for transportation to many other places in central and southern Madagascar and many tourists visit to take the FCE train to Manakara. It is the centre of Madagascar's Betsileo ethnic community. The city can serve as a basis for numerous activities and day trips in the surroundings.

Name: Ihosy
Description: Ihosy is a town in Toliara Province of Madagascar.

Name: Morondava
Description: Morondava is a town on the coast of Western Madagascar.

Name: Taolagnaro
Description: Taolagnaro (also known by its French name of Fort Dauphin) is a city in the Toliara Province of Madagascar. It was the first permanent French settlement in Madagascar.

Name: Toliara
Description: Toliara is a coastal city at the southern terminus of RN7 in the Toliara Province of Madagascar.

Name: Anakao
Description: Anakao is a tiny beach village in Madagascar.

Name: Andringitra National Park
Description: Andringitra National Park is in  Madagascar.

Name: Ile aux Nattes
Description: Ile aux Nattes is a small island of the east coast of Madagascar.

Name: Masoala National Park
Description: Masoala National Park is in the Antsiranana Province of Madagascar. It is one of six national parks on the east coast of Madagascar that make up the UNESCO World Heritage site Rainforests of the Atsinanana.

Name: Nosy Be
Description: Nosy Be is a resort island in northwestern Madagascar.

Name: Ranomafana National Park
Description: Ranomafana National Park is located close to RN7 in Fianarantsoa Province of Madagascar.  It is holds 41,600 hectares (161 square miles) of rain forest that is home to several lemur species, is accessible by paved road, and contains a variety of lodging options, making it a popular destination for visitors to Madagascar. It's one of the six national parks that make up the UNESCO World Heritage Site Rainforests of the Atsinanana.

Name: Tsingy de Bemaraha Reserve
Description: Tsingy de Bemaraha Reserve is in the Mahajanga Province of Madagascar.
